content.text:
# BAFTA Award for Best Film Not in the English Language__disambig_2

The BAFTA Award for Best Film Not in the English Language is a film award given annually by the British Academy of Film and Television Arts and presented at the British Academy Film Awards. The award was first given at the 36th British Academy Film Awards, recognising the films of 1982, and until 1990 was known as the Best Foreign Language Film. Prior to this, films recorded in a language other than English were often recognised in the category BAFTA Award for Best Film, known between 1949 and 1969 as Best Film from any Source.
In the following lists, the titles and names in bold with a gold background are the winners and recipients respectively; those not in bold are the nominees. The years given are those in which the films under consideration were released, not the year of the ceremony, which always takes place the following year.
Winners and nominees
was the first winner of this category in 1982 winning for Christ Stopped at Eboli.]]
won for Danton (1983)]]
won for Colonel Redl (1985)]]
won for Ran (1986)]]
won for The Sacrifice (1987)]]
won for ''Babette's Feast (1988)]]
won for Cinema Paradiso (1990)]]
won twice for Raise the Red Lantern (1992) and To Live (1994).]]
won twice for Central Station (1998) and The Motorcycle Diaries (2004).]]
won thrice for All About My Mother (1999), Talk to Her (2002), and The Skin I Live In (2011).]]
won for Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon (2000).]]
won for Amores perros (2001).]]
won for In This World (2003).]]
won thrice for The Beat That My Heart Skipped (2005), A Prophet (2009), and Emilia Perez (2025).]]
won for Pan's Labyrinth (2006).]]
won for The Lives of Others (2007).]]
won for I've Loved You So Long (2008).]]
won for Amour (2012).]]
won for The Great Beauty (2013).]]
won for Ida (2014).]]
won for Wild Tales (2015).]]
won for Son of Saul (2016).]]
won for The Handmaiden (2017).]]
won for Roma (2018).]]
won for Parasite (2019).]]
won for Drive My Car (2021).]]
won for All Quiet on the Western Front (2022).]]
won for The Zone of Interest (2023).]]
